title: Some rappers drop better verses on other artists' albums than their own. Why is this? - Quora

response.answer_text: Could be down to a number of reasons. Honestly, I don’t think this is deliberate most of the time. Maybe it’s just your personal preference, that you like those verses more. It can be a coincidence too. In case a rapper is featuring on an album of a more well-known artist, they probably want to bring their best game, to gain more exposure. Pusha T’s career for example got a real boost after he featured on Kanye West’s My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy. one of the best and most acclaimed hip hop albums of the decade. His verses on So Appalled and Runaway were both great. Look where Push is at now, he released 3 pretty good albums, his last one DAYTONA especially got huge critical praise. I’d also say most features on albums are on the songs considered best, or potential breakout hits. Typically, the tracks that are considered “fillers” don’t tend to have that many features on them. It may be just the case of the song itself being better, and that’s why you consider the particular verse better.
The energy in the other artists. They bounce off each other. Also, HipHop- emcing is very competitive, that being said out of fun they try outshine one another!
